name: I/O Extended 2017 Jalingo
description: Google I/O is an annual developer festival held at the outdoor Shoreline Amphitheatre Mountain View, California in May 17-19, 2017. Since not everyone can make it all the way to San Francisco, so to bring I/O into local communities worldwide, GDGs are organizing event series called I/O Extended. The event bring local developer community together to experience talks and watch keynote from the IO, Product demos, Speaker Sessions and Codelabs. GDG Taraba will be hosting I/O Extended in Jalingo featuring  Keynote Replay, Speaker Deck Presentation,and Codelabs.

name: Devfest Jalingo 2017

venue.name: Taraba State University
venue.address_1: Taraba State University, Jalingo P.M.B. 1167, Taraba State Nigeria

description:
GDG DevFests are large, community-run developer events happening around the globe focused on community building and learning about Google’s technologies. This year GDG Taraba is hosting Devfest, Titled: “DevFest Jalingo 2017”.
Devfest Jalingo 2017 will bring together GDG communities, NGOs, Entrepreneurs, Students, etc, within and outside Taraba State, to interact, innovative and proffer solution to problems peculiar to our community.
how_to_find_us: No 36 hospital road Jalingo, Taraba State.

name: Cloud Study Jam

venue.name: Taraba State University

description:
Study Jams are community-run study groups for students on Google Developers content, on various product topics. Study Jams framework brings together community members who are interested in learning about the Google Cloud Platform (GCP). EVENT AGENDA:

11:30 PM Review key concepts in creating Qwiklab and how to use the Tokens given
12:00 PM Analyzing and Guiding Students on the assigned Labs.
12:30 PM Address questions related to creating and using the QwikLab Tokens
1:00 PM Lunch Break
1:30 PM Networking/Group photo

name: International Women's Day [IWD Jalingo] 2018

venue.name: Taraba State University
venue.address_1: Taraba State University, Jalingo P.M.B. 1167, Taraba State Nigeria

description:
• What we'll do
We are proud to be hosting the 2018 International Women's Day Celebration, a women's tech conference. This event will highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs.

[International Women's Day (March 8) is a global day celebrating the social, economic, cultural and political achievements of women. The day also marks a call to action for accelerating gender parity. International Women’s Day, is a day to celebrate the achievements of women while calling for greater equality within our communities. As Women Tech makers powered by Google Developer Groups (GDG Jalingo), we plan to do this by improving our programs thus increasing women GDG members through increased collaboration and raising awareness through social media. This years IWD theme is Building a new Horizon. We intend to use this opportunity to expand our activities and offer women within our host community a platform to collaborate and fulfill their potential as techs and entrepreneurs.]

[Event Agenda:]
Time Frame / Topic
•30 min Arrival and Registration of Attendees / Tag Collection.
•15 min Introduction/Icebreaker Keynote
•30 min Entrepreneurship: What Can I Do?
•30 min Android Design Principles
•30 min Contribution of Women in ICT:
(Including a short video from an inspirational female role model.)
•30 min Lunch Break
•30 min Application of ICT in Every Field
(i.e Healthcare, Education, etc)
•30 min Why join WTM?
& How to participate in WTM activities?
•30 min Discussion Panel / Q & A All the speaker 10 min Group Photos]

• What to bring
Laptop

• Important to know
This event is targeting women developers, designers, entrepreneurs, students etc. Though men are also invited, but we need to abide by the code of conduct of the group, we should try and do this.
how_to_find_us: Faculty of Science E-Library, Taraba State University

name: Build Actions for Your Community [Google Assistant Meetup]

venue.name: Taraba State University
venue.address_1: Taraba State University, Jalingo P.M.B. 1167, Taraba State Nigeria

description:
We are proud to be hosting our first "Actions on Google" Google Assistant in our community.

[Build Actions for Your Community is an open and modular event series designed by Google and offered to community organizers worldwide. Actions on Google and Google assistant are one of the major Google technical areas and we (GDG Jalingo) want to invite the whole developer community to learn about creating Actions for Google Assistant.
Google Assistant Meetup Jalingo is an event that brings developers, students, tech enthusiasts, to learn how to build actions for our community using Google Assistant SDKs, to create multiple solutions using the Dialog Flow.]

[Event Agenda:
Time >Length >Topic Details
>9:30 am 30 min Registration
Attendees arrive, get their badges and drinks

>10:00 am 10 min Welcome
Introduction of community/facilitators/team, goals of the event series, share agenda

>10:10 am 30 min Building Conversational Experiences with Actions on Google
Overview:
Google Assistant and Actions on Google

>10:40 am 30 min Conversational Design Intro
Overview:
Conversational Design

>11:10 am 15 min Share Ideas
Coffee & tea time, attendees start to share ideas

>11:25 am 40 min Facts about you: Bitcoin Info Codelab OR Animal Joker
Attendees can choose one or the other codelab to
learn how to create VUI (Agent/Natural Language Understanding Module in Dialogflow)

>12:05 pm 55 min [LUNCH]

>13:00 pm 150 min Create your Actions on Google
After a short intro: Teams/attendees create their Actions for their communities

>15:30 pm 40 min The Good, Bad, and Ugly
Teams fill out the feedback form and share with the group their experiences on Actions on Google

>16:10 pm 40 min Showcase created Actions
Teams present their Actions

>16:50 pm 10 min Goodbye
Share resources for the event series

>17:00 pm open
[GOODBYE OR EVENING SNACKS/PIZZA/ DRINKS]
Networking time]

name: GDG DevFest 2018 Jalingo "Digital Wellbeing of the community"
description:
GDG DevFest 2018 is our annual developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon and more!

This year's theme is: "Digital Wellbeing of the community".

This is a gathering of developers from and within Jalingo, with guest speakers from Yola, Minna, Kaduna, Benue, etc.
Google technology enthusiasts will cover multiple product areas such as: Android, Firebase, Android Things, Flutter, Google Cloud Platform, Google Assistant, IoT, Machine Learning, Mobile Web and Artificial intelligence.

P.S: First to register will be given free GDG T-shirts and lots of swags for everyone! RSVP NOW!

name: ARCore '18 - Jalingo [Event-in-a-box]
description:
After the success of #Devfest '18, we are pleased to announce to you about our end of the year workshop. Join us this December for something special "ARCore" (Augmented Reality).

ARCore is Google’s platform for building augmented reality experiences. Using different APIs, ARCore enables your phone to sense its environment, understand the world and interact with information.
Some of the APIs are available across Android and iOS to enable shared AR experiences.

As an attendee, you'll not only be a part of our vibrant community but also you'll learn How:

● Motion tracking allows your phone to understand and track its position relative to the world.
● Environmental understanding, which allows the phone to detect the size and location of all type of surfaces: horizontal, vertical and angled surfaces like the ground, a coffee table or walls.
● Light estimation, which allows the phone to estimate the environment's current lighting conditions.

Don't forget to bring a laptop (PC, Mac, or Chromebook), and get ready for the best ARCore experience!

Make sure to RSVP to receive upcoming information about ARCore and visit https://developers.google.com/ar/discover/concepts to learn more about ARCore.

name: Cloud Study Jam Jalingo
description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.
Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

Agenda:
11:00 am: Welcome / Registration
12:00 pm: Get free access to Qwiklabs
12:30 pm: 3 Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs:
Lab 1: Introduction to SQL
Lab 2: BigQuery Qwik Start
Lab 3: CloudML Engine Qwik Start
01:30 pm: Break
02:00 pm: Cloud Speech API
03:00 pm: Event ends
